abstract: Royal Dutch Shell is selling a number of assets, including its European liquid petroleum gas businesses, to fund a £28 billion capital spending program, The Financial Times reported.
snippet: Royal Dutch Shell is selling a number of assets, including its European liquid petroleum gas businesses, to fund a £28 billion capital spending program, The Financial Times reported.
lead_paragraph: Royal Dutch Shell, the oil and gas company, is selling a number of assets, including its European liquid petroleum gas businesses, to fund a £28 billion ($42 billion) capital spending program, The Financial Times reported, citing people involved in the proposed deals.

headline.main: Shell Plans $3 Billion Asset Sale, Report Says
